title: AES Electronic Export Information (EEI) Filing
description: Enables the electronic submission, modification, and cancellation of export shipment data to the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Automated Export System (AES) according to specified requirements.
user_roles: Vessel Carrier/NVOCC acting as Forwarding Agent
functionality: Create and transmit new export shipment filings.
Modify (replace/change) previously accepted shipments (e.g., change port of export).
Manage multi-commodity shipments (add, delete, update lines).
Support specific commodity data requirements (e.g., multiple units of measure, large quantities).
Report shipments by various modes of transport (air, truck, vessel).
Handle different filing options (e.g., Post-Departure Option 4).
Report various Export Information Codes (EICs), including mandatory and optional (e.g., HH, IS).
Process shipments involving specific geographies (e.g., US-Puerto Rico trade).
Manage and report export control licenses (BIS, DDTC/USML) and related information (ECCNs, license numbers, exemptions, ACM#).
Report specific commodity types with additional details (e.g., used vehicles with VINs).
Perform pre-transmission validation to identify potential errors.
Process and handle AES responses, including fatal errors requiring correction and resubmission.
benefits: Ensures compliance with U.S. export reporting regulations.
Automates and streamlines the export declaration process.
Facilitates accurate data submission through validation.
Supports diverse and complex export scenarios, including licensed goods and special filing options.
Enables efficient management and correction of export filings.
